name: Isandlwana Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing - in fact it was more like visiting some old (well off!) friends. With only 12 rooms, none of which have a TV, guests are encouraged by the polite and amiable staff to mingle and converse.
reviews.title: Fantastic Short Break

likes.liked: — Big comfy rooms with no TV

reviews.text: The rooms were of a good standard, clean and well maintained. If the lack of a TV puts you off, then you are probably the sort of person who wouldn't enjoy this style of hotel.
reviews.title: excellent experience
Spectacular almost beyond description
reviews.text: The hotel benefits from a fantastic vista, indeed the same vista afforded to the Zulu commander as he oversaw his army in the battle of Isandlwana. It's a stunning view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent - from the lavish buffet breakfast to the gourmet dinners - and the service and attitude of the staff was highlly professional but friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful lodge, excellent battlefield tours

description: Isandlwana Lodge offers twelve luxury rooms all en-suite and tastefully decorated in a mixture of traditional and modern styles. The Lodge is carved into the iNyoni rock formation on top of which the Zulu commander stood during the battle of Isandlwana on 22 January 1879. Enjoy unparalleled views from the crisp early light of a sparkling Zulu dawn to the splendor of the African sunset.
